description.narrative:
The JR programme for 2021 has been designed according to identified priority governorates, based on those where humanitarian needs and gaps are known to be high and where members have access and presence to implement, either directly or with local partners, or a combination. As the scale of the crisis in Yemen deepens, it has been challenging to focus programming in limited areas of impact, though the aim remains to deliver a multisectoral response as much as possible.

ZOA, in partnership with SDF, will work in Hajjah (Kulhan Ash Sharaf and Shares) and Al Mahwit (Milhan). The activities will include latrine construction and hygiene kits for 320 HHs, rehabilitation of 6 water systems, hygiene promotion, and cash for work for 330 HHs. The total number of beneficiaries will be 23,249. (5,789 girls, 5,998 boys, 5,743 women, and 5,719 men)

title.narrative: CSH-I2 - Number of people benefitting from conditional and unrestricted cash

description.narrative: Cash for work activities. CfW projects will be chosen by the community and linked to water supply (for instance road paving for access to water sources, etc.).

comment.narrative: ZOA used some underspending from other categories to increase the number of CFW beneficiaries. In total, 529 vulnerable household received conditional cash assistance (400 unskilled workers and 129 skilled workers) as per FSAC standards who rehabilitated the communities assets in the targeted areas.

title.narrative: WSH-I1 - Number of people having regular access to soap to meet hygienic needs

description.narrative: Distribution of hygiene kits for 320 HHs.

comment.narrative: Due to adding 26 latrines to the originally proposed 320 latrines, 342 hygiene kits have been distributed successfully to 342 HHs who benefited from the construction/ rehabilitation of latrines.

title.narrative: WSH-I2 - Number of people having access to dignified, safe, clean and functional excreta disposal facilities

description.narrative: Access: ratio (user/facility) of 1 toilet for a max. 20 people, distance < 50 metres from dwellings, or as locally agreed. Clean: regular cleaning and maintenance for public facilities. Dignified: Use of toilets respect cultural preference and is arranged by household(s) and/or segregated by sex. Unsafe facilities: unstable (unlined) pits with risk of collapse, pits accessible to vectors, pits contaminating water tables and poorly sited facilities which expose women and girls to attacks, especially at night. Functional facility: fully constructed, in working order and properly maintained, of a type and in a location acceptable to intended users, with hand washing facilities and anal cleansing material.

comment.narrative: Construction/ rehabilitation of latrines for 320 HHs. At the start of the project ZOA will conduct a technical assessment to find out if community based approaches for sanitation such as as CLTS and PHAST can be considered in the target locations. In the case the results are positive, this approach will be preferred and the number of latrines is likely to rise.
The target of constructing/rehabilitating 320 household latrines was achieved. An additional 26 latrines could be constructed (partly funded through ZOA's private funding).

title.narrative: WSH-I4 - Number of people having access to sufficient and safe water for domestic use

description.narrative: Rehabilitation/ construction of 6 water supply sources at communal and health facility level, training of 6 Water User Committees and 3 technical personnel from local authorities. Target is reach of Health Facilities. BNF from indicator CSH-R2 subtracted to avoid double counting.

comment.narrative: 9 water supply sources (6 in community level, and 3 in health facility level) were successfully rehabilitated. Within the available budget, one water scheme in the community level was added to cover additional villages, which results in an overachievement of the target.

title.narrative: WSH-I6 - Number of people reached with hygiene promotion/awareness raising activities

description.narrative: Hygiene promotion through: training of 24 community hygiene promoters, HH visits, awareness raising, events and cleaning campaigns. Target is 23,249 planned individuals (5,789 girls, 5,998 boys, 5,743 women, 5,719 men). Not counted as they are included in both targets of indicator WSH-R4 plus CSH-R2.

comment.narrative: Due to the reduction of the available period to implement this activity after signing the SA, and due to the increasing in the total number of the reached beneficiaries by the water schemes, A total of 44 CHVs and 4 CHV-supervisors in both governorates had been selected and trained on the the hygiene promotion awareness, who conducted HHs visits. A total of 30349 Individual reached through the hygiene promotion awareness raising activity and hygiene events.
